meanings.definition: To commit or promise more than one can realistically fulfill.
meanings.sent1: She keeps overcommitting to help everyone, but then she gets overwhelmed.
meanings.sent2: I need to be careful not to overcommit myself to too many projects at once.
meanings.sent3: He thought he could handle overcommitting to three parties in one night, but ended up exhausted.
meanings.sent4: Her habit of overcommitting to social events is like juggling too many balls at once.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of overcommitting can lead to disappointment and burnout.

meanings.definition: To agree to do more than one is capable of doing.
meanings.sent1: They are overcommitting to volunteer for every event this month.
meanings.sent2: I tend to overcommit by saying yes to too many responsibilities.
meanings.sent3: Overcommitting to bake 100 cookies for the bake sale seemed like a good idea at the time.
meanings.sent4: She realized she was overcommitting when she agreed to finish the project in one day.
meanings.sent5: The risk of overcommitting is feeling overwhelmed and stressed out.
